metadata.name: INTERFERENCES #54
metadata.description:
INTERFERENCES is an abstract representation of the incredible collaboration between artists, collectors and developers on fxhash.

Each edition is composed of a multitude of lines representing each individual on the platform. The color of each line defines the role of each individual in this universe. Through their interactions, and the interferences they produce, each line participates in the creation of a common work.

Happy birthday fxhash! And congratulations to all those who work for its success.

Primary sales are donated to the Processing Foundation

[TOUCHSCREEN]
* Double Tap to save the current image

[KEYBOARD]
* Press [S] to save the current image
* Press [1] to save a 1500x2000 pixels PNG
* Press [2] to save a 3000x4000 pixels PNG
* Press [3] to save a 6000x8000 pixels PNG
* Press [0] to save 3 individual SVG for each color set of lines + the background image PNG
* Press [9] to save a grouped SVG of all the lines + the background image PNG

Artist: Estienne
Nov. 2022
NFT License 2.0

Credits to Piter Pasma (@piterpasma) for the Reumann-Witkam line simplification algorithm used in this generator

objkt.name: a fistful of silicates, eroding, slipping #32

metadata.name: a fistful of silicates, eroding, slipping #32
metadata.description:
a fistful of silicates,
‚Äá‚Äáimpotent and frail,
‚Äá‚Äá‚Äá‚Äáeroding, slipping

‚Äá‚Äáby Chris Eugene Mills
‚Äá‚Äá‚Äá‚Äá‚Äá(cem_futuretense)
‚Äá‚Äá‚Äá‚Äá‚Äá2023

// Interaction // ===============

double click/tap = scale to best fit
scroll/pinch = change scale
swipe down‚Äá= save a PNG screenshot (2x res)
swipe up = toggle fullscreen

press‚Äá[ ] = pause
press‚Äá[f] = fullscreen
press [w] = fill window (wallpaper mode)
press‚Äá[s] = save a PNG screenshot (2x res)
press‚Äá[v] = save a WEBM video (10sec)
press [0] = scale to best fit
press‚Äá[1-6]‚Äá= change scale
press [shift] = toggle looking around (while zoomed in)

press‚Äá[t] = see title
press‚Äá[p] = performance widget
press [e] = low-fps mode

// URL Parameters // ============

[scale]‚Äá= float, zoom/scale (best fit integer)
[w],[h]‚Äá= integer, canvas size (800x600)
[flip]‚Äá‚Äá= bool(0|1), match landscape/portrait (1)
[fill]‚Äá‚Äá= bool(0|1), override and fill window (0)
[smart] = float, percent of knowledge base (0.3-0.7)
[safe]‚Äá‚Äá= bool(0|1), low-fps mode (0)

// Guide // =====================

This work fits to your pixels, best it can, not just your frame. I prefer it portrait 4:3, up to you! 

To avoid flicker, please set your display scale/DPI and browser zoom to 100%. For persons who are epileptic or flash-sensitive, a low-fps mode is provided.

Note: This is a realtime WebGL animation, and can be GPU-intensive. May not load on older devices. On iOS Safari, some gestures are not compatible, while color resolution may be slightly degraded.

// Credits // ===================

The source imagery is all clipart found in the Internet Archive and a thrift store in Nanaimo, British Columbia. 

Cheers to ciphrd, for their article on glsl pixelsorting which inspired this project. It also led me to fxhash.

Made with cables.gl, which will receive 10% of primary proceeds and royalties.

Doctors Without Borders will receive 40% of both via the Giving Block.

issuer.name: a fistful of silicates, eroding, slipping

metadata.name: Concrete #336
metadata.description:
640 unique sketches of imaginary walls, inspired by the work of Norwegian architect Erling Viksj√∏ (1910‚Äì1971) and his artist collaborators. Viksj√∏ designed the Government Quarter in Oslo and invited artists from different disciplines to help design the facades and interiors of the buildings.

Viksj√∏‚Äôs aim was to ‚Äúsoften‚Äù modernist architecture. He invented ¬´Natural Concrete¬ª, a type of concrete that deliberately exposes the mixed-in stones on its surface to give it warmth and a human touch. In my work, I have similar ambitions‚Äîusing code instead of concrete.

The different styles of the piece are inspired by, and dedicated to some of the artists who worked together with Viksj√∏: Jakob Weidemann (~2%), Carl Nesjar (~18%), Odd Tandberg (~30%), and Tore Haaland (~50%).

In live mode, press ‚ÄòS‚Äô to save an image at current resolution or ‚ÄòP‚Äô to save a high-resolution file at 6000√ó6000px (this might take a while depending on your hardware).

Original artwork by Andreas Rau ¬∑ Made with p5.js & glsl ¬∑ Oslo, 2021

metadata.name: Sequence #420
metadata.description:
Sequence by Hevey (@HeveyArt).

This artwork was created using p5js.

metadata.name: Klyft #400
metadata.description:
‚ÄúKlyft‚Äù is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at PARIS+ par Art Basel.

Klyft is a juxtaposition of two different projections for the future. One, made by the World Economic Forum, suggests that the global gender gap will have closed by the year 2154. The other, by the UN IPCC, estimates that global warming will reach 3.2 degrees celcius by the year 2100.

Klyft makes use of the unique temporal aspect of computational art by developing its expression gradually over the next 132 years. As we come closer to 2154, the space between the two shapes in Klyft will grow smaller to symbolize the closing of the gender gap. As time goes on, however, Klyft also becomes more and more glitched out to represent the projected increases in greenhouse gases and climate catastrophes.

In the end, Klyft‚Äôs expression will be heavily corrupted, and the two shapes will have reached each other.

¬∑ URL parameters ¬∑

You can add the following parameters to the URL to change the behavior of the piece.

date=<YYYY-MM-DD> ‚Äî See how Klyft looks on another day. Use the format YYYY-MM-DD. 

color=<number> ‚Äî See the piece in another color scheme. The numbers loop around, so 17 equals 0, 18 equals 1, etc. 

resolution=<number> ‚Äî View the piece in a higher resolution. 1 is normal resolution, 2 is double, etc. No decimals allowed.

image=true ‚Äî Save the piece as an image. 

record=true ‚Äî Save the piece as a video in WEBM format.

Adding the following URL parameters will show Klyft in double resolution on the day gender equality is achieved according to the WEF:

date=2154-01-01&resolution=2

Adding the following URL parameters will save a video of Klyft in the ‚ÄòStokkendahl Dalgas‚Äô color scheme:

color=14&record=true

¬∑ Interactions ¬∑

Pressing the following keys will trigger functionality as well as add related URL parameters automatically. 

Pressing D will increment the date by 1 year.

Pressing C will increment the color index by 1.

Pressing R will toggle between normal and double resolution.

Pressing I will toggle the image URL parameter, which saves the piece as an image. Only works outside of iframe.

Pressing V will toggle the video URL parameter, which saves the piece as a video. Only works outside of iframe.

There are secret key presses as well. Some of them only work outside of iframe. 

¬∑ Accessibility ¬∑

Klyft is built to support screen readers. It has been tested using MacOS‚Äô VoiceOver, and uses p5.js‚Äô describeElement() to provide screen reader functionality.

If you have any comments (good or bad) on the screen reader integration, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out on my Twitter: @ada_ada_ada_art. 

¬∑ Credits and license ¬∑

Klyft is made with p5.js.

Klyft is licensed under a modified version of the Climate Strike License (CSL).

metadata.name: Mediterranean #147
metadata.description:
How diverse can nature be?

Created with p5js.
Code takes a few minutes to complete. Needs a good CPU.
Works faster on Chrome browser.
For high-res images: Type a resolution multiplier number on live view. If you type 2, it will render 2 times larger than your screen size. Press "s" to save.

metadata.name: xDeads  #2721
metadata.description:
The xDeads are 11x11 pixel art collectible characters, generated algorithmically on-chain with proof of ownership stored on the Tezos blockchain. It‚Äôs one of the first collections of generative PFP‚Äôs based on Hydra, and implemented using p5 and createloop libraries.

There are a few functions for interacting with art: Press 'p' to download screen 1500x1500 (live mode) Press 'x' to download a 5 second gif (Live Mod) Click on screen to play/pause music and make art interact. ( it can take time )

What are those xDeads, afterall?

Everything starts when a company named xCorp, a bulwark on technology on the planet, began their evil plan in the name of profit: control human minds in order to alienate the population in whatever the corporation wants and needs. This alienation power was only possible by the possession of a rare, mysterious and mistic objkt: a pickle, that contains an absurd energy power that no one knows its origin.

In the past, the xCorporation concentrate its power and resources on I.A. and robot engineering - and this was their first mistake. The second one was to focus only on the alienation project, leaving all the robots on their own, who started to settle their own plan: to conquer the sacred objkt, the pickle, and use it to their own interests.

Eventually, the robots reach the supremacy of the world, leaving all the human kind, now dumb and disaffected, wandering like zombies. 100 years in this mess have passed when a mighty eclipses emerges on the sky, heralding the arrival of hungry aliens, atracted by the power of the pickle.

In fact, it was the aliens, back when the human race did not exist in the planet, who plant the seed of the pickle, hoping to get back when the objkt reach its final form. It was the pickle power in the earth who give the humans consciousness, and only this objkt can make them go back to their normal state.

The whole earth is now a battlefield: aliens, robots and zombies struggling to have the possession of the artifact in order to keep their survival.

xDeads Features: The xDeads world is subdivided in three Classes: Robots, Zombies, Aliens. All of them include the Emission gas: Tezonium, Carbon and Lead. The classes are, as well, overwelmed by alignment: Lawful Neutral, True Neutral, Chaotic Neutral. Lawful Good, Neutral Good, Chaotic Good. Lawful Evil, Neutral Evil, Chaotic Evil. The xDeads have Background features too: Gray, White, Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Purple, Black. And the last feature is an important one, the Ki, wich represents the power of each xDead(in rarity order): in Robots, in Zombies, in the Aliens

If you have luck, your xDead‚Äôs Ki will be over 9000!

..and one more thing

All the xDeads come with a modular music and a reaction system that moves with the frequencies of the amplifier embedded to the NFT: a music that tells part of the history, and how your xDead connect with the chaotic world it had born. All of the tracks were composed by dead_marcelo on Vcvrack, a eurorack synthesizer.

The perception of the pixel in xDeads philosophy

As Professor Herbert W. Frank once said, it is well known nowadays that the brain and the sensory organs function on a physical basis and that perception itself is above all a kind of data processing. We are all the time learning and regurgitating the information we received. But the thing doesn‚Äôt stop right there. The human brain have multiples steps in processing information, variating since memories till fully conscious analysis.

In the pixels world ‚Äì more specifically in the xDeads world ‚Äì the perception of the nature of each creature is no different. What is a pixel if not a squared extension of what we see everyday? When you see pixels on a screen you are looking at molecules or atoms that are emitting or transmitting light. Light itself does not consist of molecules.

We use this type of abstraction to tell xDeads history and, perhaps, predict the future.

metadata.name: Gentrax EP #136
metadata.description:
Gentrax EP is a generative audiovisual artwork. Each iteration produces a generative house/garage track ~3 minutes in length while drawing out accompanying artwork. Live piece is aspect ratio agnostic and scales to any window size, but an aspect of 1:1.414 is preferred and can be set with an URL parameter.

Audio controls:
1-7: Channel mutes/unmutes
a: Filter up 
z: Filter down
c: Flanger on/off
v: Reverb (cycle thru three settings)
q: Switch bassline octave&seq (cycle thru three settings)
b: Portamento on/off

Visual controls: 
p: Fast forward to final artwork
o: Save canvas

Url parameters: 
&w=800 : Set width of canvas. If aspect ratio is not defined, artwork will be in preferred aspect ratio (1.41414)
&a=1.5 : Set aspect ratio. number <1 = Wide canvas
&wl=1 : Locks canvas aspect ratio to preferred 


made with p5.js & tone.js
Using tonejs synthesis for bass plus oneshot samples from various drum machines & Alpha Juno 2
<3

CC-BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Bound #291
metadata.description:
Knots bind and hold, mark time, and unite. But the power of a well-tied knot isn't only to fasten ‚Äì it also symbolizes how tightly one holds their pledges. Whether a commitment to a partner, community, or oneself ‚Äì the longevity of a deeply held bond is often marked with a symbol of passing time, like knots tied in a rope.

Let these ropes remind us of the binds we hold ‚Äì new ones, lengthy ones, unbreakable ones, and even those we‚Äôve had to untie. In plain view, these knots invite us to contemplate what our bonds mean to us, and to see them anew.

---

Press ‚Äò1‚Äô-‚Äô9‚Äô to increase resolution
Press 's' to save an image of the output at the current resolution

Created with p5.js
For third party license information, please see license.md

---

TENDER x David Brice Allen
July 2022

metadata.name: Speed of Dark #212
metadata.description:
Simple shapes, when strewn broadly and systematically, suggest the presence of infinite creative possibilities and are capable of portraying a visceral excitement felt by mixing the energy of light with the contemplation of dark.

This exercise has been repeated for ages, and its relevance will remain for as long as light may meet dark. The silhouettes of Stonehenge battling against a bright sky, the wabi-sabi placement of rocks in a Japanese garden hugged by methodical raking, the play of shadows in Plato's Allegory of the Cave, and the playfully arranged cut-outs of collage or chemical photogram ‚Äî these all attest to the unending dynamism of form when imbued with light and the contrast of its absence.

As absence and darkness are made visible, the trail of their path conveys a speed as fast as light, and dark shapes that are no less important than the brightest figures. A symbiotic coexistence of these forces was born with the universe ‚Äì and a delicate balance remains between the powerful glare of light and the stealthy speed of dark.

Inspired by photograms and a little-known series by documentary photographer William Klein, Speed of Dark references the visual language of the darkroom and the history of photography as an underlying analog for how an emerging art medium can harness simple elements to create evocative expressions.

Choose a resolution by adding "&width=9000" to the URL in live view.
Remove the border by adding "&noborder=1" to the URL.

__________
TENDER x Laurent Houdard
May 2022

metadata.name: fx(haish) / the Generator #285
metadata.description:
fx(haish) is my contribution to #fxhashturnsone
fx(haish) is not a finished product
fx(haish) is a co-creation experiment
fx(haish) is a fun exploration of a mixed GenAI process

fx(haish) is my Happy Birthday to fx(hash). 

Have fun, collectors!


// HOW TO PARTICIPATE

Step 1. Mint or collect ‚Äúfx(haish) - the Generator‚Äù
Step 2. Visit https://www.arqtistic.com/fx(haish) to generate your ‚Äúfx(haish) - The AI City‚Äù based on your mint. You have 20 tries.
Step 3. Await further instructions.


// FURTHER INFO

This algorithm has been designed to produce images which are suitable for the subsequent AI generation. The token consists of a random number of randomly placed and sized rectangles, filled with a noise gradient pattern. In short, Diffusion AI Models thrive on noise.

The AI generation uses Stable Diffusion 1.5 through an API designed by the 330ai team (@Pixelmindai). The WebUI has been developed by Nik0gda (@AntonCebanu2). AI Prompt has been designed (by me) to produce images of Cities, but you can possibly make it do other things, if you try hard enough.

metadata.name: PersianSCII #21
metadata.description: PersianSCII carpets are crafted to be timeless pieces that fit perfectly within your virtual home.  With inspired designs, flawless craftsmanship, and indestructible materials, PersianSCII carpets are made for a life lived beautifully.

metadata.name: sky high #40
metadata.description:
A city in clouds.
For my new project I moved away from landscapes tried to recreate some city sketches.
Made using p5.js and p5.scribble library

metadata.name: sunset for plotters #47
metadata.description:
sunset for plotters o mirant al cel

minimal, animated and plottable artpiece about sky colors during sunset in Premia de Mar, Barcelona

- one click to stop and restart animation
- double click to change clouds and sun position
- press 0 for svg mode, then press "v" to save svg
- press 9 for high resolution mode
- press 1 for standard mode
- press "s" to save png
- press "g" to save 10 seconds GIF

by mekhno / Marc L Clapers
2024

metadata.name: The Math text-book #131
metadata.description: The math text-book contain 256 pages of colorful math formulas, rendered in PETSCII text-mode.

metadata.name: Life has no scores #104
metadata.description:
We cannot compose life, at best we hum along to the melodies that life has been played in front of us. Looking back at the scores of our lives, the notations are never neatly noted, but fully felt.  Rewinding the songs of life are our memories, whether sad, happy, angry, or melancholy. It is not clear whether I am dreaming or awake, but our songs all do end. 

In this final drop (for ?), I have reused the first ever class calligraphy(){} I have written from my genesis drop ‚ÄúNothing comes from nothing‚Äù. As time passes, 10 drops later, across almost to the year, I am grateful for the progress I have made, as an artist, and more importantly as a human. After all, what is behind the code of generative art is a human being. 

Scores of music, scrolls of calligraphy, calendar or diary, notating life, time passes, and changes are inevitable. Sometimes we sing louder in laughter and joy, sometimes we scribble in uneasiness, sometimes we just get lost in neon lights. Life goes on. You and me, all the same and yet different.  

There are too many friend artists, friend collectors, fxhash team members, to thank for helping me through this journey. I would like to pay homage to Rudxane in this work, who has taken me under his wings, mentoring and encouraging me in art as well as showing me some degen stuff on the side:-). This homage is not copy-minting, or copying of styles, which I do not have the coding skills to do so even if I wanted to. But it is the influence of taste in many works of Rudxane. In a vague but agreeable taste, I present to you Life has no scores. 

What I was taught was disrupted, and grid studies left unfinished, and oh do we have a BINGO?

Tested on Chrome. Other browsers may render different or not at all (firefox)

Press ‚Äò2‚Äô to save png.

Copyright (¬©) 2022 Jimi Wen
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0
